intro: Endeisa, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. They typically grow in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Endeisa species are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
